#Text=Choose Lettering For Your Boat
#Text=If you buy a boat , you are likely to make naming your boat and adorning the transom with the boat lettering name of your choice .
#Text=Why not make it a safety device as well ?
#Text=Steps
#Text=There are many grades of adhesive vinyl letters available .
#Text=Your best choice would be a premium outdoor grade with a rating of 7 years or more .
#Text=Do n't be mislead by vendors selling cheap " promotional vinyl " on the various re-seller places on the internet .

column3:
object[27]	giv[27]	_	_
7-10	400-411	promotional	object[27]	giv[27]	_	_
7-11	412-417	vinyl	object[27]	giv[27]	_	_
7-12	418-419

column1: #Text=7 year vinyl is substantially more expensive than 60 day banner vinyl .
#Text=With vinyl boat lettering , you get what you pay for .
#Text=You can purchase individual letters from an office supply store .
#Text=You will have to hand lay your own letters and there will be few choices to spice up the style or color of your boat name lettering .
#Text=A better choice would be to order your boat lettering decals online or at a local vinyl fabricator .
#Text=You can add a remarkable level of night safety if you order your boat lettering in reflective boat lettering decals .
#Text=There are a number of companies that sell custom reflective boat lettering decals .
#Text=There are even places online whereby you can design your boat lettering online and see the results before ordering .
#Text=Installation of a custom made boat lettering decal can be a tricky event .
#Text=Several of the manufacturers recommend a wet method of boat lettering installation .
#Text=One vendor , Streetglo Reflective Decals has an online video showing the wet method of installation ( http://www.streetglo.net/boat-lettering.html ) .
#Text=Click on the camcorder to see the actual video showing the wet procedure to install boat lettering decals .
#Text=There is also a link at Streetglo to an online boat lettering decal design tool that lets you design and save your boat lettering decal project .
#Text=This nifty utility will save your boat lettering design and display it on the transom of a typical boat .
#Text=Picking a name for your boat is easy with the thousands of suggestions available on the internet .
#Text=Search for " boat names " on Google and you will be presented with a large number of boat name links to begin the process of choosing your boat name .
#Text=Tips
#Text=A good layout and measurement is the only way you can massage the letters to look like a professional would install .
#Text=If you buy your boat numbers cut straight and try to install them on the bow of the boat ... they will appear curved down - like a frown because the bow is curved in and up .
#Text=In order to lay on perfect numbers on the bow of a boat you need to tack some " butcher " paper to the bow with masking tape .

column3:
object[166]	new[166]	_	_
27-20	2516-2523	butcher	person|object[166]	new|new[166]	coref	29-5
27-21	2524-2525

column1: #Text=Sketch the lines of the boat hull onto the paper .
#Text=When you remove the butcher paper and lay it on a flat table you will see that the lines are curved up ( when viewing the port side ) .
#Text=Make sure the vinyl lettering dude distorts the numbers to match your legend line .
#Text=Repeat the procedure for the starboard side .
#Text=You cannot use the same straight cut numbers on both the port and starboard bow and have them look professional .
